intro: Viola sylvestris subsp. caspia, commonly known as the Caspian violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus and parts of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, featuring heart-shaped, hairy leaves and violet or purple flowers with five petals. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces capsule fruits that contain several small, dark seeds. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species within the Violaceae family.
